name.cantanima.chineseremainderclock

Class CRC_View_Linus

  • java.lang.Object
    • name.cantanima.chineseremainderclock.Clock_Drawer
      • name.cantanima.chineseremainderclock.CRC_View_Linus

  • public class CRC_View_Linus
extends Clock_Drawer
    This class extends Clock_Drawer for the Linus design, a polygonal design that highlights the number of line segments corresponding to the remainder. For general documentation on Clock_Drawer, see that class. This file only documents groups of lines to explain how Linus works.
    See Also:
    Clock_Drawer

    • Method Detail

      • preferred_step

        float preferred_step()
        One frame every tenth of a second
        Specified by:
        preferred_step in class Clock_Drawer

      • draw

        protected void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Description copied from class: Clock_Drawer
        This should draw the clock onto the specified Canvas. The usual order of events should be to invoke setup_time() FIRST, then (if desired) drawTimeAndRectangle(), which takes care of the background. Only then should you perform the drawing specific to the design! At the end, a subclass should also invoke usual_cleanup(). If you follow this course of events, then the values hour, minute, second, last_h, last_m, last_s will be set up properly so that you can read them for animation, and all other "ordinary" set up and destruction will be taken care of.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Clock_Drawer
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which to draw the clock

      • recalculate_positions

        void recalculate_positions()
        For Linus we use an array of points which we feed to the drawLines() command. Animation is accomplished by a parametric function between the old point and the new point. drawLines() requires each intermediate endpoint to appear twice: once as the last point of a line, once as the start. So intermediate endpoints are stored twice, and we can draw using shifting (<< 2). See the drawLines() documentation for details.
        Overrides:
        recalculate_positions in class Clock_Drawer
        See Also:
        Canvas.drawLines(float[], int, int, android.graphics.Paint)
